text: Linda Lavin (October 15, 1937 - December 29, 2024) was an American actress and singer. She was known for playing the main character in the sitcom Alice and for her stage roles both on Broadway and Off-Broadway. She had her first Tony Award nomination in Last of the Red Hot Lovers in 1970. In 1987, she won a Tony Award for her role in Broadway Bound.Embry, Ingerline Voosen."Linda Lavin biography" Jewish Women's Archive, retrieved October 15, 2010 Lavin won two Golden Globe Awards in 1978 and 1979.
